item.title: A Multi-Reference Relaxation Enforced Neighborhood Search Heuristic in SCIP
item.description: arXiv:2408.00718v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This paper proposes and evaluates a Multi-Reference Relaxation Enforced Neighborhood Search (MRENS) heuristic within the SCIP solver. This study marks the first integration and evaluation of MRENS in a full-fledged MILP solver, specifically coupled with the recently-introduced Lagromory separator for generating multiple reference solutions. Computational experiments on the MIPLIB 2017 benchmark set show that MRENS, with multiple reference solutions, improves the solver's ability to find higher-quality feasible solutions compared to single-reference approaches. This study highlights the potential of multi-reference heuristics in enhancing primal heuristics in MILP solvers.
item.dc:creator: Suresh Bolusani, Gioni Mexi, Mathieu Besan\c{c}on, Mark Turner
